text: The aim of this questionnaire is to learn about your perception of neighbourhood in terms of your well-being, climate changes, environmental issues and urban design.
It refers to YOUR NEIGHBOURHOOD - the place where you live and its nearest surrounding within of 15 minutes walking distance.
The questionnaire takes about 15 minutes to finish. It is divided into 5 sections with questions.
This part refers to your perception of your neighbourhood design.

questions.question: Is your neighbourhood nicely designed with well structured streets and buildings?
Is your neighbourhood equipped with basic services within walking distance?
Is your neighbourhood equipped with electricity, sanitation, drinking water infrastructure?
Is your neighbourhood combined with enough green spaces and parks?
Is your neighbourhood walkable, easy to walk around?
Is your neighbourhood supported by public transport?
Is your neighbourhood supported by cycling routes?
Is your neighbourhood friendly to children and family activities?
Is your neighbourhood friendly to disabled or older adults?
Is your neighbourhood with areas where you can do outdoor sports?

text: This part refers to your perception of your well-being.

questions.question: (What do you feel regarding living in your neighbourhood?) Are you feeling being happy?
(What do you feel regarding living in your neighbourhood?) Are you feeling being secure?
(What do you feel regarding living in your neighbourhood?) Are you feeling being satisfied with life?
(What do you feel regarding living in your neighbourhood?) Are you feeling being isolated?
(What do you feel regarding living in your neighbourhood?) Are you feeling being discriminated?
(What do you feel regarding living in your neighbourhood?) Are you feeling being depressed?
What is your subjective perception of your well being level?
How much physical condition makes an impact in your well-being?
How much economic condition makes an impact in your well-being?
How much social relations make an impact in your well-being?
How much emotional state makes an impact in your well-being?
How much psycological condition makes an impact in your well-being?
How much neighbourhood development makes an impact in your well-being?
How much engaging activities and work make an impact in your well-being?

text: This part refers to your perception of pollution and disturbances you may experience in your neighbourhood.

questions.question: Please share your views concerning this topic (If pollution is a serious problem in your neighbourhood).

titles: Section 4: Awareness of climate change effects
text: This section refers to your perception of climate change and exposure to climate change effects and your actions.

questions.question: How much do you concern about environmental issues of your neighbourhood?

answer.answer: 1 I do not concern at all.

questions.question: Are you exposed to floods?
Are you exposed to shortage of drinking water?
Are you exposed to thermal extremes?
Are you exposed to droughts?
Are you exposed to none of the (floods, droughts, thermal extremes, shortage of water)?
If you are engaged in activities, what are the determinants of your participation?

answer.answer: I have the resources, skills and knowledge to participate
I have a sense of attachment that reinforces participation
I am involved by official bodies or voluntary groups
I see evidence that my views have been considered

questions.question: How often are you engaged in monitoring the quality of city environment (floods, air pollution ect.)?
How often are you engaged in participating in city/local planning discussions?
How often are you engaged in participating in Non-Governmental Organisation projects?
How often are you engaged in volunteering for healthcare improvment?
How often are you engaged in solving problems that affect the community?
How often are you engaged in improving the appearance of the surroundings?
How often are you engaged in electing for neighbourhood associations?
How often are you engaged in implementing energy, water and greenary saving solutions?
Please share your views concerning this topic.
